Understate: The claim underestimates the significance of population growth in relation to the number of people currently working.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the statement that more people are working now than at any time in history.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge that previous presidents, such as Barack Obama, could have made the same claim during their tenure.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there have been exceptions, such as during recessions, when the number of people employed has declined despite population growth.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the achievement of having more people working now than at any time in history by not considering the steady increase in population.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not providing evidence that supports the statement made by President Trump.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that having more people working now than at any time in history is a remarkable feat without considering other factors such as population growth.
